      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.Character c)
        Description copied from interface: CBstADT
        Insert c into this tree. If c is already in the tree, ignore the insert request.

        Example

        Given the following tree, 

             d
    / \
   b   f
  /   /
 a   e
        if insert('c') is called then the resulting tree would be 
              d
     / \
    /   \
   b     f
  / \   /
 a   c e

        Specified by:
        insert in interface CBstADT
        Parameters:
        c - the Character to insert into this tree

      • isBalanced

        public java.lang.Boolean isBalanced()
        Description copied from interface: CBstADT
        Determine if this tree is balanced. A tree is balanced if the tree is empty or both of the following are true:
        • the difference between the heights of the left subtree and right subtrees is less than 2, AND
        • both subtrees are balanced

        Example

        This is a balanced tree: 

              d
     / \
    /   \
   b     f
        / \
       e   g
        This is NOT a balanced tree: 
              d
       \
        \
         f
        / \
       e   g

        Specified by:
        isBalanced in interface CBstADT
        Returns:
        true if this tree is balanced, false else

      • position

        public java.lang.Integer position(java.lang.Character c)
        Description copied from interface: CBstADT

        Determine the position of the given Character in this tree. The position of the root is 0, its left kid is 1 and right kid is 2, and so on.

        Example

        Here are the first 7 positions: 

              0
     / \
    /   \
   1     2
  / \   / \
 3   4 5   6
        So, given the following tree, 
              d
     / \
    /   \
   b     f
  / \     \
 a   c     g
        the positions of each Character would be
        Character Position
        a 3
        b 1
        c 4
        d 0
        f 2
        g 6
        g is at position 6 because position 5 is where the left kid of f would be.

        Specified by:
        position in interface CBstADT
        Parameters:
        c - the Character whose position is to be determined
        Returns:
        position of c if c is in this tree, else -1

      • preorder

        public java.lang.String preorder()
        Description copied from interface: CBstADT

        Determine the preorder traversal of this tree.

        Example

        Given the following tree, 

             c
    / \
   b   e
  /   /
 a   d
        The preorder traversal would be cbaed.

        Specified by:
        preorder in interface CBstADT
        Returns:
        preorder traversal of this tree

      • remove

        public void remove(java.lang.Character c)
        Description copied from interface: CBstADT

        Remove the given Character from this tree. Do nothing if the given Character is not in this tree.

        Example

        Given the following tree, 

              d
     / \
    /   \
   b     f
  / \   / \
 a   c e   g
        calling remove(d) will result in 
              c
     / \
    /   \
   b     f
  /     / \
 a     e   g
        Be sure to review the notes and book on remove.

        Specified by:
        remove in interface CBstADT
        Parameters:
        c - the Character to remove
